intro: Galium apiculatum, commonly known as slender bedstraw, is a low-growing herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, ascending stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its fruit is a small, dry capsule that contains numerous tiny seeds. Galium apiculatum is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
